headline.main: Danish Study Shows Wine Aiding Longevity

docs.lead_paragraph: Another large study has highlighted the potential benefits of alcohol to health and longevity. But unlike previous studies, this one showed that only wine, not beer or hard liquor, was associated with a longer life and that its apparent protective effect was far greater than has been found elsewhere. The 12-year study, conducted among more than 13,000 men and women ages 30 to 70 who participated in the Copenhagen Heart Study, revealed that those who drank wine daily were much less likely to die during the study period than those who drank beer or liquor or no alcohol at all.
